column2: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy
column5: The implementation of joint projects for renewable energy production can lead to a reduction in energy consumption, which in turn can help reduce the EU's overall energy consumption and support the achievement of the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the 2020 EU Reference Scenario.

column2: The amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030
column5: An increase in the share of renewable energy in the transport sector can contribute to a reduction in waste and plastic litter at sea, as renewable energy sources can replace fossil fuels and reduce the amount of waste generated.

column2: Each Member State shall increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector by at least 0.8 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2025
column5: An increase in the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector may lead to an increase in the use of biomass, which can have negative impacts on soil health and biodiversity, potentially hindering the achievement of the target of reducing chemical pesticides use by 50% by 2030.

column2: By 2022, achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State’s binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to the restoration of degraded ecosystems, including forests, which can help to achieve the target of planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030.

column2: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of renewable sources in the amount of energy sources used for final energy and non-energy purposes in the industry sector by an indicative increase of at least 1.6 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the periods 2021 to 2025 and 2026 to 2030
column5: An increase in the share of renewable energy in the industry sector can lead to a reduction in nutrient losses, as renewable energy sources can replace fossil fuels and reduce the amount of nutrients released into the environment.

column2: A target of 15% electricity interconnection for 2030
column5: The achievement of this target can facilitate the cooperation on joint projects for renewable energy production, leading to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the energy mix.

column2: Indicative target of at least a 49% share of energy from renewable sources in the building sector in the Union’s final energy consumption in buildings in 2030
column5: An increase in the share of renewable energy in the building sector can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year
column5: A reduction in energy consumption by public bodies can contribute to a reduction in overall energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario
column5: A reduction in energy consumption by public bodies can contribute to a reduction in overall energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030
column5: A reduction in energy consumption can contribute to a reduction in primary energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing primary energy consumption to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030.

column2: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings is renovated each year
column5: The renovation of buildings can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the building sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Reduce buildings’ final energy consumption by 14%
column5: A reduction in final energy consumption by buildings can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the building sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030
column5: An increase in the energy renovation rate of buildings can contribute to a reduction in energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: Reduce buildings’ energy consumption for heating and cooling by 18% compared to 2015 levels by 2030
column5: A reduction in energy consumption for heating and cooling can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Member states will have to renovate 16% of worst-performing non-residential buildings by 2030
column5: An increase in the energy renovation rate of buildings can contribute to a reduction in energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings
column5: The renovation of worst-performing buildings can contribute to a reduction in primary energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing primary energy consumption to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030
column5: A reduction in primary energy use by the residential building stock can contribute to a reduction in primary energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing primary energy consumption to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030.

column2: By 2030, the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix should double to 55-60%
column5: An increase in the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix can facilitate the achievement of the target of 15% electricity interconnection for 2030.

column2: Member States are required to achieve cumulative end-use energy savings from 2021 to 2030
column5: The achievement of cumulative end-use energy savings can contribute to a reduction in energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: When identifying and implementing the restoration measures to meet the objectives and obligations set out in Articles 4, 6, 7, 8, 9 and 10, Member States shall aim to contribute to the commitment of planting at least three billion additional trees by 2030
column5: The restoration of degraded ecosystems, including forests, can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the energy mix, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of at least six out of seven of the following indicators in forest ecosystems
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the industry sector, leading to a reduction in nutrient losses.

column2: Member States shall achieve an increasing trend at national level of the common forest bird index
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Reach no net land take
column5: The achievement of this target can facilitate the cooperation on joint projects for renewable energy production, leading to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the energy mix.

column2: Member States shall take the measures necessary to ensure that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to a reduction in energy consumption, supporting the achievement of the target of reducing energy consumption by at least 11.7% in 2030.

column2: The Ambient Air Quality Directives set EU air quality standards for 12 air pollutants
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the transport sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: The Industrial Emissions Directive aims at preventing or reducing emissions from large industrial installations and intensive farming into the environment
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the industry sector, leading to a reduction in nutrient losses.

column2: The revised Urban Wastewater Treatment Directive extends the scope of the 1991 UWWTD to improve and maintain access to sanitation for all
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an improvement in water quality, supporting the achievement of the target of ensuring that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing chemical pesticides’ use by 50%, by 2030
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses use by 50%, by 2030
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the industry sector, leading to a reduction in nutrient losses.

column2: Improve air quality to reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55% by 2030
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the transport sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%)
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the transport sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an improvement in water quality, supporting the achievement of the target of ensuring that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean.

column2: Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity, by 2030
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the transport sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Reduce the share of people chronically disturbed by transport noise by 30%, by 2030
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the transport sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: Having all soils in healthy condition by 2050
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an increase in the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector, leading to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions.

column2: By means of an updated and harmonised list of pollutants affecting surface and groundwater
column5: The achievement of this target can contribute to an improvement in water quality, supporting the achievement of the target of ensuring that water intended for human consumption is wholesome and clean.
